author: JEFF FLETCHER
title: ANGELS: Eppler to be named new GM
text:
BY JEFF FLETCHER Oct. 4, 2015 Updated: 9:35 p.m. ARLINGTON, Texas â" The Angels are wasting little time in moving on with their offseason, selecting Billy Eppler as their next general manager.
Eppler, the assistant GM of the New York Yankees, is expected to be officially announced Monday.
Eppler takes over for Bill Stoneman, who had been serving as interim GM since Jerry Dipoto resigned on July 1.
Eppler had spent the past four years as the Yankees assistant GM, a promotion he received just after being a finalist for the Angels opening when Dipoto was hired in 2011.
Eppler had worked in the Yankees front office in various scouting and baseball operations jobs since 2004.
Prevoiusly, Eppler had spent five years working for the Colorado Rockies.
A San Diego native, Eppler graduated from the University of Connecticut with a finance degree in 1998.
From the time the search began, Eppler was considered the favorite.
The Angels also interviewed three internal candidates: assistant GMs Matt Klentak and Scott Servais, and director of pro scouting Hal Morris.
Among the external candidates, Dodgers vice-president Josh Byrnes was the most experienced. The Angels also interviewed Mariners farm director Chris Gwynn, Blue Jays assistant GM Tony LaCava, Indians vice-president of player personnel Ross Atkins and Boston Red Sox assistant GM Mike Hazen. Hazen was hired to be the Red Sox GM.
